info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued September 8 at 2:01PM EDT until September 10 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville FL
info.description:
* WHAT...For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding expected around times of high tide.
* WHERE...Coastal Flagler County.
* WHEN...For the High Rip Current Risk, through late Tuesday night. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to 5 AM EDT Wednesday.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction:
If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don't swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.

parameter.value: HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 AM EDT WEDNESDAY
